meanings.definition: Knurs (noun): small, hard, round growths on a tree
meanings.sent1: The knurs on the old oak tree looked like tiny bumps.
meanings.sent2: I collected some knurs that had fallen from the branches.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels used the knurs as seats for their acorn feasts.
meanings.sent4: The knurs on the tree were like nature's ornaments.
meanings.sent5: The knurs added character to the tree, making it unique.

meanings.definition: Knurs (verb): to make a harsh, grating noise
meanings.sent1: The rusty gate knurs loudly when opened.
meanings.sent2: The old car engine knurs as it struggles to start.
meanings.sent3: The wind made the branches knurs against the window.
meanings.sent4: The gears in the machine knurs as they turn.
meanings.sent5: The metal door knurs as it swings back and forth.

meanings.definition: Knurs (adjective): having a rough, uneven texture
meanings.sent1: The knurs surface of the rock made it difficult to climb.
meanings.sent2: The knurs edges of the wooden table needed sanding.
meanings.sent3: The knurs texture of the fabric felt scratchy against my skin.
meanings.sent4: The knurs road was bumpy and uncomfortable to drive on.
meanings.sent5: The knurs wall was rough to the touch, like sandpaper.
